title: 12.4 Conflicts - tto123
description: Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollectie voor Engels voor tweetalig onderwijs, leerjaar 1, 2 en 3. Dit is thema 12 'Relationships. Het onderwerp van deze les is: Conflicts. Deze les gaat over ruzie en onenigheid met partner of vreemden, met daarbij voornamelijk het oplossen ervan zoals excuses aanbieden. In deze les wordt een grammaticatoets gegeven die de elementen toetsen die in dit thema zijn behandeld (imperative, de gerund en de betekenissen van live, lives en life).

items.content:
The subject of this period is arguments and conflicts.

  • Form groups of three or four pupils.

Discuss the following questions in your group:

  • Have you ever argued with somebody you did not know?
  • If yes, what was the argument about?
  • What do you know about conflicts in the world?
  • What is FARC? If you don't know the answer, look it up on the Internet.
Step Activity Aim Time
Introduction Find out what you already know. 10
Step 1 Listening
Arguing with a stranger		 You can understand a recording about arguing with a stranger and answer questions about it. 15
Step 2 Reading
Peace in Colombia		 You can understand a text about Colombia and answer questions about it. 15
Step 3 Vocabulary You can understand and use the vocabulary about conflicts. 15
Step 4 Grammar
Grammar test		 You can take a grammar test. 15
Step 5 Speaking
A discussion about conflicts		 You can have a discussion about conflicts. 10
Step 6 Writing
An essay about arguments with strangers.		 You can write an essay about arguments with strangers. 15
Step 7 Evaluation Reflect on what you have learnt. 05
Step 8 Extra
10 Conflicts		 Watch the video.

Arguing with a stranger
You are going to listen to six people talking about arguments with strangers.

  • Listen to the recording and do assignment 1.
  • Read the statements.
  • Listen again and do assignment 2.

Assignment 1

Copy and fill in the grid (on your own) and discuss the answers in your group.

Name

Argument (use key words)

Lindsay

Katia

Kat

Warren

Sarah

Rese


Statements

  1. Lindsay had an argument at the theatre.
  2. Lindsay didn't say anything to the man who was screaming.
  3. Katia is very shy.
  4. Kat very often argues with strangers.
  5. Warren had an argument in a pub.
  6. Warren had a fight with a Guns and Roses fan.
  7. Sarah only had an argument with a stranger once.
  8. Sarah had a bicycle accident.
  9. Rese never had an argument with a stranger.
  10. Rese only argues with family.

content.body:
Are the following statements true or false ?​

Lindsay had an argument at the theatre. True False
Lindsay didn't say anything to the man who was screaming. True False
Katia is very shy. True False
Katia often argues with strangers. True False
Warren had an argument in a pub. True False
Warren had a fight with a Guns and Roses fan. True False
Sarah only had an argument with a stranger once. True False
Sarah had a bicycle accident. True False
Rese never had an argument with a stranger. True False
Rese only argues with family. True False

items.content:
Peace in Colombia
You are going to read a text about peace in Colombia.

  • Read the text and do assignment 1.
  • Read the text again and do assignment 2.

Assignment 1

Copy and fill in the grid (on your own) and discuss the answers in your group.

In this text there are a lot of numbers. What do they stand for? (use key words)

52

220,222

2

2

1964

57

2nd

Peace in Colombia
Colombians are celebrating as peace has finally come to Colombia. Colombia's government signed a peace deal with the rebel group FARC. The deal ends 52 years of fighting, during which 220,000 people died and millions had to leave their homes. The deal comes after two years of talks between the two sides. Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos called the deal, "the beginning of the end to the suffering, pain and tragedy of war". A spokesman for the Colombian government said: "The war is over but also there is a new beginning. This agreement opens the door to a more inclusive society." Both sides will now work together for justice for the victims of the conflict and to build a stable and lasting peace.

FARC is the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia. It was formed during the Cold War to fight for farmers and workers. It started its fight against the Colombian government in 1964. It will now take part in the legal and political process to shape Colombia's future. In Bogota, the capital city, thousands of people came out to celebrate the news of the peace deal. One Colombian, Orlando Guevara, 57, told the Associated Press news agency: "I can die in peace because finally I'll see my country without violence, with a future for my children." The next step is for the Colombian people to vote on the peace deal on the 2nd of October. President Santos said: "It will be the most important election of our lives."

prompt.body: For how many years did FARC fight the Colombian government?
How long did the peace talks last?
What did Colombia's president say peace would end the tragedy of?
What did a government spokesman say the agreement opened?
Who will both sides now work for?
Who did FARC fight for when it first formed?
In what year did FARC start fighting the government?
When will Colombians vote on the peace deal?
Who said the election will be the most important of people's lives?

• Study the vocabulary. (10 minutes)
  • Do the exercise.

items.content:
You will finish the grammar section with a grammar test.
If you pass the test you are ready for the next step!
Good luck!

prompt.body:
Complete the two sentences.
​Use the imperative.

  1. ...... (to go) upstairs.
  2. ...... (not to play) football in the yard.

Complete the two sentences.
​Use the imperative.

  1. ...... (to switch off) your mobiles.
  2. ...... (not to play) football in the yard.

content.body: I = Switch off II = Don't play
I = Switch off II = Don't played
I = Switched off II = Don't play

prompt.body:
Complete the two sentences.
Use the correct preposition.

  1. Sue dreams ...... being a pop star.
  2. They feel ..... going to bed.

Complete the two sentences.
Use the correct preposition.

  1. How to get rich ...... working.
  2. He always talks ...... leaving.

Complete the two sentences.
Choose: live / life lives / lifes.

  1. There is ...... on the sun.
  2. Angela ...... in Rotterdam.

Complete the two sentences.
Choose: life / live

  1. ...... is short.
  2. This is a ...... concert.

Complete the two sentences.
Choose: live/life

  1. Do you still ...... in this small town?.
  2. This show is going out ...... .

items.content:
A discussion about conflicts
In your group discuss the following questions:

  • What causes conflict?
  • How can conflicts be resolved?
  • What happens to people who are involved in conflicts?
  • What conflicts are going on around the world?
  • Can violent conflicts be solved with violence?
  • How can the world be peaceful when other countries are not trying to bring peace?
  • Is it possible to avoid conflicts?
  • What kind of conflicts appear at school?
  • What should teachers, parents and pupils do to avoid and solve such conflicts?
  • Should a conflict be solved straightaway or when we calm down?

An essay about an argument with strangers.
You listened to a recording about arguments with strangers in step 1.
Now you are going to write an essay about the subject.

  • Write down if you've ever had an argument with strangers.
  • If you did, what was the argument about?
  • If not, why not?
  • Has there ever been a situation in which you were angry with a stranger?
  • Why did you not say anything? Or, what did you say?

Ask your teacher how many words you have to use.

What have you learnt in this period?
Answer the following questions:

  • What was the easiest part of this lesson?
  • What did you already know?
  • What was the most difficult part?
  • What was new to you in this lesson?
  • What do you have to ask your teacher?

10 Conflicts to Watch in 2020

In its annual outlook for 2020, Crisis Group sees a global system undergoing sweeping change. Rivalry among major powers is intensifying. Regional powers are at once emboldened and frightened by the emerging order. Often leaders see crises as opportunities to advance their interests or hurt their rivals.

  • Watch the video.
  • Which 10 conflicts are discussed in the video?
